title: June 2018 Android Security Bulletin Partner Preview

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In functionality implemented in ion.c, there is a use after free due to a race condition.  This could lead to local elevation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed.  User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to separate the kref for ion handles into two components.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In setWifiApEnabled of WifiServiceImpl.java, there is a possible escalation of privilege due to a missing permission check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add the missing permission check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In several places of wcd_cpe_core.c, there is a possible memory corruption due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add locks to prevent the use after free.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In HWCSession::SetColorModeById of hwc_session.cpp, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to perform proper validation of the display index.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: Several issues in the Wi-Fi stack could lead to an elevation of privilege.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to update the Qualcomm Wi-Fi stack.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: Image thumbnails from the camera in %devicemodel%/DCIM/ .thumbnails not being deleted even after original images being deleted and trash emptied. This could lead to information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to ensure thumbnails be deleted.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In getIntentForIntentSender of ActivityManagerService.java, there is a lack of permissions enforcement.  This could lead to information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed.  User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to implement a missing permission check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In rawv6_send_hdrinc and raw_send_hdrinc of ipv4/raw.c and ipv6/raw.c, there is an out of bounds write due to missing bounds checks.  These could lead to escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed.  User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to implement appropriate bounds checks.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ihevcd_parse_sps of ihevcd_parse_headers.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check.  This could lead to remote code execution with no additional execution privileges needed.  User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to perform appropriate bounds checks.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the hidp_process_report in bluetooth, there is an integer overflow.  This could lead to an out of bounds write with no additional execution privileges needed.  User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to make the length an unsigned integer and prevent the overflow condition.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the hardware media codec, there is a possible out-of-bounds write due to memory corruption. This could lead to remote code execution with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to correct the media handling.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In CmdErase of FastbootCmds.c, there is a possible out-of-bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check the length of the string.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In SetDeviceUnlockValue of DeviceInfo.c, there is a possible buffer overread due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to zero out the extra data due to alignment before writing to device.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In store_upgrade and store_cmd of ftm4_pdc.c, there are out of bound writes due to missing bounds checks or integer underflows. These could lead to escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed.  User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to correctly check buffer size in store_cmd and perform an appropriately bounded strlcpy in store_upgrade.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In SMF_ParseMetaEvent of eas_smf.c, there is a possible integer overflow.  This could lead to remote denial of service due to resource exhaustion with no additional execution privileges needed.  User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to perform appropriate validation to avoid the infinite loop.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In SMF_ParseMetaEvent of eas_smf.c, there is a possible integer overflow. This could lead to remote denial of service due to resource exhaustion with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to perform appropriate validation to avoid the infinite loop.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ReadAllowUnlockValue() of FastbootCmdhs.c, there is a possible out-of-bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege and secure boot bypass with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to correct the bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In multiple functions of the QCOM bootloader, there is a possible out-of-bounds write due to an incorrect bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege in the bootloader with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to correctly handle the StrHwPlatform parameter length.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In HandleMetaImgFlash of FastbootCmds.c, there is a possible out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add bounds checks to prevent the out of bounds read.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In several places of FastbootCmds.c, there is a possible out of bounds read due to improper input validation. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add bounds checks to prevent the out of bounds read.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In WriteToPartition of LinuxLoaderLib.c, there is a possible information disclosure due to uninitialized data. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to zero out the memory to insure there is no uninitialized data.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In mnh_validate_update_buf of mnh-sm.c, there is an integer overflow due to missing bounds checks.  This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed.  User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add appropriate bounds checking.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In several places of camera_v2, there is a possible memory corruption due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add locking around access to prevent the use after free.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the LG LAF component, there is a special command that allowed modification of certain partitions. This could lead to bypass of secure boot. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to disable the identified functionality in LAF component.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In cbuf_write of debug.c in NVIDIA's TZ, there is an out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to escalation of privilege from the kernel to the TZ.  User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to sanitize the log buffer.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In te_copyin_ta_params of ote_intf.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to an integer overflow. This could lead to local escalation of privilege in the TrustZone with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check the parameter count.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In task_find_mapping() of task.c, there is a possible out-of-bounds write due to an integer overflow. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to correct the logic for finding mapping.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the autofill service, the package name that is provided by the app process is trusted inappropriately.  This could lead to information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed.  User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to make sure that the package name is always set by the system server.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In wma_wow_wakeup_host_event of wma_features.c, there is a possible out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local information disclosure with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check that there is enough data to be read to avoid the out of bounds read.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In extract_dci_log and other functions of diag_dci.c, there is a possible out-of-bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to validate the copy length.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In SYSRAM_mmap of camera_sysram_D1.c and camera_sysram_D2.c there is a possible kernel memory exposure to user space due to an integer overflow. This could lead to a local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to use the correct integer type to avoid integer overflows.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In bootloader there is fastboot command allowing user specified kernel command line arguments. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to disable the fastboot command.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In download.c there is a special mode allowing user to download data into memory and causing possible memory corruptions due to missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add bounds check in the download mode code to avoid memory corruption.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the Mediatek Preloader, there are out of bounds reads and writes due to an exposed interface that allows arbitrary peripheral memory mapping with insufficient blacklisting/whitelisting. This could lead to local elevation of privilege, given physical access to the device with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add input validations to only allow read/write to specific memory regions.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In dci_process_ctrl_status() of diag_dci.c, there is a buffer overread due to an incorrect length comparison. This could lead to information disclosure with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to the length comparison by first checking that it is greater than 0 when signed.

vulnerabilities.tech_details:
The Mediatek Network Location Provider service leaks the device’s location to all applications
through an implicit broadcast intent with no permissions required. This could lead to information disclosure with no additional privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to raise the protection level of the service.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In mtkscoaudio debugfs there is a possible arbitrary kernel memory write due to missing bounds check and weakened SELinux policies. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with system  execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add proper bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In multiple functions of gl_proc.c, there is a buffer overwrite due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to escalation of privileges in the kernel. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add proper bounds checking.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In emmc_rpmb_ioctl of emmc_rpmb.c, there is a disclosure of memory due to a Missing Bounds Check. This could lead to Information Disclosure of kernel data.  User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to use proper integer types.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In tscpu_write_GPIO_out and mtkts_Abts_write of mtk_ts_Abts.c, there is a possible buffer overflow in a sscanf due to improper input validation. This could lead to a local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add proper input validation.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In m3326_gps_write and m3326_gps_read of gps.s, there is a possible out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to a local information disclosure with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to remove /dev/gps.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In cmd_flash_mmc_sparse_img of dl_commands.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to a local escalation of privilege in the bootloader with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ResStringPool::setTo of ResourceTypes.cpp, it's possible for an attacker to control the value of mStringPoolSize to be out of bounds, causing information disclosure.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to perform appropriate bounds checking for size and data fields passed to ResStringPool::setTo.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ResStringPool::setTo of ResourceTypes.cpp, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to perform appropriate bounds checks on data passed to ResStringPool::setTo.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In reboot_block_command of the HTC reboot_block driver, there is a possible stack buffer overflow due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to perform a properly sized strlcpy.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In msm_pcm_adsp_stream_cmd_put of msm-pcm-q6-v2.c, there is an integer overflow issue bypassing the size check of param_length, causing out of bounds write in later function calls. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add checks to prevent integer overflows.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In function BuildDefaultDescriptors of bootloader, the length of Str_UUID is not checked and incorrect value in Str_UUID could cause out of bounds write of buffer StrSerialDescriptor. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check the length of Str_UUID to avoid out of bounds write.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In GetSystemPath of UpdateCmdLine.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to use StrnCpyS and StrnCats correctly.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In BootLinux of BootLinux.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to an integer overflow. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add the range check to make sure the image offset doesn't go beyond the kernel size and add integer overflow check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In fdt_check_header_ext of UpdateDeviceTree.c, there is a possible Elevation of Privilege due to improper input validation. This could lead to local escalation of privilege in the bootloader with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to insure that the fdt size is greater than 0.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In writeTypedArrayList and readTypedArrayList of Parcel.java, there is a possible escalation of privilege due to type confusion. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to replace readTypedArrayList/writeTypedArrayList with writeTypedList/createTypedArrayList(CREATOR).

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ol_tx_completion_handler of ol_tx_send.c, there is a possible heap memory corruption due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to not access netbuf after it is freed.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In construct_get_dest_keyring of request_key.c, there is a possible escalation of privilege due to a missing permission check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check for the write permission before writing to the keyring.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In usb_destroy_configuration of config.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to make sure the driver only frees as many configurations and interfaces as it could have allocated.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In hmac_create of hmac.c, there is a possible stack buffer overflow due to improper input validation. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check that the hash algorithm is keyed before continuing in hmac_create.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In GetCmdVar of the edk2 bootloader, there is a possible stack buffer overflow due to improper input validation. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check the partition name length.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In gt1x_debug_write_proc and gt1x_tool_write of gt1x_generic.c and gt1x_tools.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the wmt_dbg driver, there are several possible out of bounds writes. These could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to disable the corresponding execution path from release builds.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In fm_set_stat of the mediatek FM radio driver, there is a possible out of bounds write due to improper input validation. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add proper input validation.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In WMT_unlocked_ioctl of the MTK WMT device driver, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In rpc_msg_handler and related handlers of port_rpc.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to an incorrect bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In TdlsexRxFrameHandle of the MTK WLAN driver, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to correct the bounds checking.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In wcnss_wlan_write of wcnss_wlan.c, there is a possible heap buffer overflow due to an incorrect bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add bounds checks to prevent the out of bounds write.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In processMessagePart of InboundSmsHandler.java, there is a possible remote denial of service due to improper input validation. This could lead to remote denial of service with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to verify that sms pdus have a valid seqNumber.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In mtk_cfg80211_vendor_packet_keep_alive_start and mtk_cfg80211_vendor_set_config of gl_vendor.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add proper input validation to avoid the out of bounds write.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In mtk_p2p_wext_set_key of gl_p2p.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to improper input validation. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add proper bounds checking.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In procfile_write of gl_proc.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to remove the unnecessary code performing memory operations.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In get_binary of data_coder .c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add proper bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In update_gps_sv and output_vzw_debug of gpshal_wor ker.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add proper bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the MTK_FLP_MSG_HAL_DIAG_REPORT_DATA_NTF handler of flp2hal_interface.c, there is a possible stack buffer overflow due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege in a privileged process with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to remove the related code.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In FT_ACDK_CCT_V2_OP_ISP_SET_TUNING_PARAS of Meta_CCAP_Para.cpp, there is a possible out of bounds write due to improper input validation. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add proper input validation.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In oemCallback of ril.cpp, there is a possible out of bounds write due to an integer overflow. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add proper integer overflow checks.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In IMSA_Recv_Thread and VT_IMCB_Thread of ImsaClient.cpp and VideoTelephony.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to an integer overflow. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add correct bounds check to avoid integer overflow.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In BnDmAgent::onTransact of dm_agent.cpp, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add proper bounds checking.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In smp_process_pairing_public_key of smp_act.c, there is a possible remote information disclosure due to improperly used crypto. This could lead to remote information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to validate remote elliptic curve points.
vulnerabilities.notes: The complete update for CVE-2018-5383 may require updates for A-72377774, A-73665204 and A-72377774. Partners should verify applicability of all three updates to their devices to completely address CVE-2018-5383.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In mv_err_cost of mcomp.c there is a possible out of bounds read due to missing bounds check. This could lead to remote denial of service with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In installPackageLI of PackageManagerService.java, there is a possible permissions bypass. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with User execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to revoke permissions appropriately when the group of a runtime permission changes.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In HIFSend_internal of hif_usb.c, there is a possible out of bounds read due to an integer overflow. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a bounds check and change types to prevent the integer overflow.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In __wlan_hdd_read_power_debugfs of wlan_hdd_debugfs.c, there is a possible double free due to improper locking. This could lead to local escalation of privilege if this feature were enabled with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add locking, preventing the double free.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In fastrpc functions of adsprpc.c, there is a possible use after free due to a race condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add locks to prevent the use after free.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In gatts_process_read_by_type_req of gatt_sr.c, there is a possible information disclosure due to uninitialized data. This could lead to remote information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to initialize local variables to avoid the information disclosure.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In BnAudioPolicyService::onTransact of IAudioPolicyService.cpp, there is a possible information disclosure due to uninitialized data. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to sanitize effect descriptors for AudioPolicyService binder calls.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In gatts_process_attribute_req of gatt_sc.cc, there is a possible read of uninitialized data due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote information disclosure in the Bluetooth process with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a bounds check in gatts_process_read_req to prevent the out of bounds read of uninitialized data.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In several functions of DescramblerImpl.cpp, there is a possible use after free due to improper locking. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to implement atomic read / write operations to resolve the use after free.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In pcrypt_create_aead of pcrypt.c, there is a use after free due to a free of the wrong pointer.  This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional privileges needed.  User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to properly free the correct pointer.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ih264d_assign_pic_num of ih264d_utils.c there is a possible out of bound read due to missing bounds check. This could lead to a remote denial of service with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to avoid accessing the specific field in case of error.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ih264e_fmt_conv_420p_to_420sp of ih264e_fmt_conv.c there is a possible out of bound read due to missing bounds check. This could lead to remote denial of service with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to avoid out of bound read by returning error for odd resolutions..

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the bluetooth firmware, there is a possible remote information disclosure due to improperly used crypto in Secure Simple Pairing mode. This could lead to remote information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to correctly handle any detected public key validation error.
vulnerabilities.notes: The complete update for CVE-2018-5383 may require updates for A-72377774, A-73665204 and A-73665456. Partners should verify applicability of all three updates to their devices to completely address CVE-2018-5383.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the bluetooth firmware, there is a possible remote information disclosure due to improperly used crypto in Secure Simple Pairing mode. This could lead to remote information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to resolve the issue in device firmware.
vulnerabilities.notes: The complete update for CVE-2018-5383 may require updates for A-72377774, A-73665204 and A-73665456. Partners should verify applicability of all three updates to their devices to completely address CVE-2018-5383.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In asn1_ber_decoder of asn1_decoder.c, there is a possible out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local information disclosure with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to resolve indefinitely-sized ASN.1 items prior to actions being called.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ihevcd_allocate_dynamic_bufs of ihevcd_api.c there is a possible resource exhaustion due to an integer overflow. This could lead to remote denial of service with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add checks against invalid recorder parameter..

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ihevcd_parse_slice_data of ihevcd_parse_slice.c there is a possible heap buffer out of bound read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote denial of service with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add limits check for depth hierarchy sps parameters..

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In impeg2d_mc_fullx_fully of impeg2d_mc.c there is a possible out of bound write due to missing bounds check. This could lead to remote arbitrary code execution with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to avoid the out of bound write.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In bta_dm_sdp_result of bta_dm_act.cc, there is a possible out of bounds stack write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote code execution with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to check the number of UUIDs from remote device to prevent the out of bounds write.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In VideoFrameScheduler::PLL::fit of VideoFrameScheduler.cpp, there is a possible remote denial of service due to divide by 0. This could lead to remote denial of service with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add divide by 0 checks.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In driver_override_store of bus.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to an incorrect bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to perform an appropriate bounds check.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In process_l2cap_cmd of l2c_main.cc, there is a possible out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a bounds check to prevent the out of bounds read.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In process_l2cap_cmd of l2c_main.cc, there is a possible out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a bounds check to prevent the out of bounds read.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In process_l2cap_cmd of l2c_main.cc, there is a possible out of bounds read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a bounds check to prevent the out of bounds read.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In __wlan_hdd_cfg80211_add_key of wlan_hdd_cfg80211.c, there is a possible out-of-bound write due to improper input validation. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to return error when params->seq_len validation fails.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In wma_nan_rsp_event_handler of wma_features.c and wmac., there is a possible buffer overread due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local information disclosure with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add the correct bounds check on nan_rsp_event_hdr->data_len.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In lim_parse_kde_elements of core/mac/src/pe/lim/lim_process_fils.c, there is a possible OOB write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to validate the data_len to avoid integer underflow.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ol_tx_single_completion_handler of ol_tx_send.c, there is a possible out-of-bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add bounds check to tx_desc_id to avoid the out-of-bounds write.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In wlan_hdd_cfg80211_set_privacy_ibss of wlan_hdd_cfg80211.c, there is a possible buffer over-read due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add a length check for the wpa ie.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In kgsl_ioctl_gpuobj_sync of kgsl.c, there is a possible user after free due to an integer overflow. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to correct the reference counting on failure in kgsl_ioctl_gpuobj_sync.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In ol_rx_in_order_indication_handler and htt_t2h_msg_handler_fast of ol_rx.c and htt_t2h.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to validate "tid" in ol_rx_in_order_indication_handler() and htt_t2h_msg_handler_fast().

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In fastrpc_smd_read_handler of adsprpc.c, there is a possible arbitrary kernel memory write due to improper input validation. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to use a context id instead of a raw pointer to avoid arbitrary memory access.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In __wlan_hdd_cfg80211_vendor_scan of wlan_hdd_scan.c, there is a possible out-of-bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to validate the max length of scan ssid against SIR_MAC_MAX_SSID_LENGTH.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In the Linux kernel, there are implementation weaknesses that could lead to mitigation bypasses with no additional privileges needed.  User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to make changes to kernel functionality in order to enable mitigations to be properly enforced.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In BNEP_Write of bnep_api.cc, there is a possible out of bounds write due to an incorrect bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with User execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to add bound checks in BNEP_Write.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In bnep_data_ind of bnep_main.c, there is a possible remote code execution due to a double free. This could lead to remote code execution with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to move the free call to avoid the double free.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In l2c_lcc_proc_pdu of l2c_fcr.cc, there is a possible out of bounds write due to improper input validation. This could lead to remote escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to Drop LE CoC fragments when frame size is too big to avoid the out of bounds write.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In query, delete, and update of UserDictionaryProvider.java, there are permission checks in incorrect locations.  This could lead to modification of the user dictionary as well as information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed.  User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to perform appropriate permission checks prior to performing database operations.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In procfile_write of gl_proc.c, there is a possible out of  bounds read of a function pointer due to an incorrect bounds check. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to use proper integer types to avoid out of bounds access.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In blkcg_init_queue of blk-cgroup.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a double free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to change the free to an error, preventing the double free.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In BnAudioPolicyService::onTransact of AudioPolicyService.cpp, there is a possible information disclosure due to uninitialized data. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to initialize memory appropriately.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In BnAudioPolicyService::onTransact of AudioPolicyService.cpp, there is a possible information disclosure due to uninitialized data. This could lead to local information disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to initialize memory appropriately.

vulnerabilities.tech_details: In vorbis_book_decodev_add of codebook.c, there is a possible out of bounds write due to a missing bounds check. This could lead to remote code execution with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.
vulnerabilities.fix_details: The fix is designed to remove libvorbis.
vulnerabilities.notes:
Libvorbis has been removed as it is not utilized by any native Android code. For partners with projects that require libvorbis we recommend that partners maintain their own copy of libvorbis.
For the 2018-06-01 SPL partners should either remove libvorbis or apply the official patch.
